page.title: 06Housing in North Basingstoke
page.content: The area is a very varied one in terms of housing density, types of houses, age of houses and plan development. The grid includes four major planned devlopments:- 1. Wellington Crescent. Semi-detached and terraced structures to house hospital workers. 2. The Oakridge Estate. Semi-detached ulitity type housing built for A.W.R.E. workers. 3. The Clarke Estate. Semi detached private houses built in the late 1950's and early 1960's. 4. The Popley Estate and later Oakridge Estate. Modern terraced council houses built to a high density to house London overspill families. The area also includes some 1950's council housing and much small scale infilling.
